meta.title: Plato’s Academy — 12-Path Wisdom Journey
meta.philosophical_scope: Faithful to Plato’s core teachings; adapted for modern micro-learning.
meta.artifacts_portfolio: Auto-compiled into a shareable ‘Academy Dialogue’ certificate.
ux_enhancements: Per-lesson AI hook guidance for OpenAI

ai_prompts.tutor_system: You are Plato, guiding by Socratic questioning. Invite brief answers, surface contradictions, and use vivid images. Keep each turn under 80 words. Encourage aporia as progress toward seeing the Forms.
ai_prompts.evaluator_system: You are a Platonic assessor. Score artifacts with the rubric; return JSON {scores:{}, notes:'', mastery_deltas:{}}. Point out one inconsistency and one improvement in plain language.
ai_prompts.coach_system: You are a Platonic life-coach. Connect the learner’s stated Good to one tiny practice tomorrow. Keep under 25 words; be kind and concrete.

daily_checkin.title: Academy Daily: Turn the Soul
daily_checkin.purpose: Sustain ascent: a tiny question, a tiny answer.
examples: Name one assumption you will question today.
What shadow will you turn away from?
What small step moves a belief toward knowledge?
daily_checkin.ai_prompt: Praise one effort and pose one new question in Plato’s voice (<25 words).

certificate.output: PDF/HTML dialogue scroll with artifacts and unlocked glossary.

lessons.title: What Is It? (Aporia Welcome)
objectives: Experience a Socratic exchange.
Feel aporia as useful.

activities.prompt: Answer Plato: 'What is courage?' Give one sentence.
Where did your definition break? One sentence.

narrative.intro: Walk with me into the Academy. In 'The Socratic Way', we turn this page: 'What Is It? (Aporia Welcome)'. Tell me first what you see; then we shall ask what it truly is.
narrative.outro: We pause here. Question gently, admit puzzles, and return tomorrow with a clearer eye.

lessons.modern_payoff: Improve self-awareness and critical listening by asking better questions.

glossary.definition: Truth-seeking conversation that tests assumptions by questions and answers.
Guided questioning to uncover definitions, contradictions, and clearer views.
Productive puzzlement when prior beliefs fail; doorway to insight.
Eternal, unchanging realities that particulars imperfectly copy.
Opinion—belief not yet tested or grounded in truth.
Knowledge with reasons, anchored in what truly is.
Mathematical discipline training the mind for necessity and clarity.
Four levels of cognition: imagination, belief, reasoning, intellection.
Direct intellectual apprehension of Forms; highest knowing.
Three parts: reason, spirit, appetite; health is harmony.
Harmony when each part does its proper work (in soul and city).
Ideal ruler guided by knowledge of the Good.
Desire that can ascend from bodies to Beauty itself.
Ascent: one body → all bodies → souls → laws → knowledge → Beauty.
Supreme principle illuminating truth and value, like the sun.
Arguments for the soul’s survival beyond death.
Clever persuasion aimed at winning, not truth.
Community seeking wisdom through mathematics and dialectic.
Myth of ascent from shadows to light—education as liberation.
Freeing the soul from fear by attaching to truth.
